Reviews.Title: “Nice location and good price”
Reviews.Author: Cmon83
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very good located and you reach the old town easy by feet, but the hotel itself is in a safe, calm neighborhood. The price is very good, so don't expect a 5-Star Hotel. But it's clean, nice and small. The breakfast was also ok, nothing to complain in this price range, above average. We took a room with it's own bathroom, the price wasn't much more and maybe it's worth it...for us it was. Would definitely stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you like mold, then stay here”
Reviews.Author: mreinik
Reviews.Content: Room 12. Mold, mold and more mold. For older people; there is no elevator and stairs are very deep.

Reviews.Title: “Great choise for single traveller!”
Reviews.Author: Miko358
Reviews.Content: I had a most pleasant stay in hotel crystal at november 2011. Single room was worth its price (45e/night) room was big and room icluded tv with very sharp screen and bed was adequate, toilet and shower are shared but very clean. Breakfast is included with room price and it is very good breakfast there were 2 kind of breads and toaster for them, also cheese cold meats cereals and boiled eggs were offered and coffee machine had many kind of coffees. Location is great not a far away from tourist attractions such as Leidseplein Vondelpark and Rijksmuseum, centraal station is 20minutes walk away from hotel. I would stay again on hotel crystal and i recommend this hotel for anyone. If your looking for relaxing quiet and comfortable place to stay for a while in amsterdam alone or with friends, then this is definitely the best budget opinion i found it worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tushkanchik220
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decent considering that in Amsterdam in general the prices for lodging are very high. a perpendicular staircase (but I've heard that it's a common problem for Amsterdam:) Quite a small room. We were living 4 of us in 1 rooms and didn't expect it to be so small Decent breakfast Great location! It's not in the heart of the city which makes it very quiet at night but very close to the center Near the park Reception is friendly Quite clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Tacky and expensive for the quality”
Reviews.Author: bimbrandy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really terrible, the stairs are extremely steep and the staff doesn't seem to have been very professional or friendly. They gave us a top floor room knowing we had a 5-year old with us, which was very small and so hot we could barely sleep because of the heat. We had to keep the window open at nights but facing the street, it was nearly impossible to sleep with the windows open. I have trouble trying to imagine how this hotel could have ever passed any safety checks, there is no fire drill on the walls or anything indicating which way you should escape in case of a fire... On top of all that, last night we had an encounter with a mouse in our room who was cosily trying to help himself to our freshly bought Dutch cheese. All in all, a disappointment :(

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfy”
Reviews.Author: Bogsyben
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in the city. It is near the vondelpark as well as most of the museums. Staff are accomodating! Will be back there next year.

Reviews.Title: “An almost perfect place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Hobozero64
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam this year to (quietly) celebrate my 21st. I went with a friend of mine and decided that considering we'd only be there for 4 days/nights we might as well share a double room as most of the time would be (and was) spent out of the room any way. The room was affordable, very clean and always immaculate when we'd return in the evening. Shower facilities were too, nice and clean. My ONLY reservation about the Hotel Crystal is the very cramped shared toilet. I'm only 5ft 11" yet had difficulty using the WC comfortably. Breakfast consisted of some nice cold meats, cheeses, egg, toast etc. (Continental) and was more than enough to set us up for the day. Staff too were always on hand and very helpful (like a lot of the Dutch we met). Just outside Liedesplien, the Hotel Crystal is a mere 5 minute walk to Liedesplien itself and from here the No. 1 tram will take you anywhere of interest in the city (including back to Centraal Station for the journey home). Liedesplien has all you need to enjoy a great time in Amsterdam but don't let that stop you from seeing the rest of what is an amazing city. Liedesplien has great coffee-shops (e.g. 'The Rookies'), great food (like all you can eat ribs for â‚¬10 from the Sports bar next to The Bull Dog bar, again very cool place) and many other nice bars and restaurants. Not to mention within walking distance of the Museum district inc. the Van Gough and the Rijksmuseum. Put it this way, my pal wants to go for HIS 21st in December and we'll more than likely go right back to the Hotel Crystal.

Reviews.Title: “My goodness the bathrooms were bad”
Reviews.Author: Gdoublerb
Reviews.Content: It's Europe on the cheap, so we weren't expecting much, but our expectations weren't met. This was by far the worst hotel on our European adventure. The hotel is central enough. The #5 and #1 trams would take you all the places you'd want to go, and it's an easy enough walk to Van Gogh, Reiksmuseum and Vondelpark. There was no wifi, although it was promised...ok, no biggy. The bathrooms and showers are shared by the tenants on the floor. Nobody over 5'9 could possibly have used the toilet. Really, I'm being serious. Because the bathroom was so small, the floor had a constant puddle of urine or toilet water present. In the shower, though large, a pile of hair grew larger each day of our visit. It was never cleaned. The room seemed secure and mostly clean. The bathroom facilities were deplorable. deplorable!

Reviews.Title: “Always wear my heels when looking at the mirror!”
Reviews.Author: loveantoinette
Reviews.Content: So I know Dutch people are known to be very tall and all but the funniest thing about this hotel was the fact that I couldn't even see my face in front of the sink mirror! I'm only 5'2 and I was barely able to see my forehead. Thank God for that full-length mirror on the closet door! Aside from that whole mirror deal, this hotel is cute and very charming, near Leidseplein (about a 5-10 minute walk) My [private] single room was surprisingly spacious and very clean! The toilet was right outside my room (I had rm#14) and the shower which was right down the hall was very clean as well! I wasn't icked out about having to share the shower facilities since they maintained it very well! The stairs are a whole 'nother issue to deal with.. it's practically similar to climbing up a ladder! Thank God I left my other luggage at the airport and had a medium daypack with me - makes a BIG difference what kind and how much luggage you'll be bringing into this place. The walls are a bit thin and you can almost hear everyone outside your room. Frankly I didn't care; I was only in my room in the wee hours of the night after a full day of excursion/drinking/cycling and all the other good stuff Amsterdam has to offer. Simple, free breakfast was also served: some bread/rolls, ham/salami slices, cheese, hard boiled eggs, juice/coffee/tea. Nothing fancy but enough to hold anyone over until lunch. Since Amsterdam is a bit expensive when it comes to food, I made some sandwiches and packed it in my bag for some snacking/mini picnic in Vondel park. The only issue I had was their WiFi; since I was on the third floor it was very weak! First you have to get the Username/PW from the front desk and I believe it's only good for 2 hours; after that you have to go back to the front desk and get a new UN/pw. (I guess it's their way of preventing just about anyone from freeloading off the wifi... who knows) When I comeback to Amsterdam, I'll def come back here!

Reviews.Title: “It added value to our journey”
Reviews.Author: SamanSriLanka
Reviews.Content: We had a nice 02 days stay in Amsterdam. Thank you Hotel Crystal. The only problem we felt was the carrying baggages to the upstair. No elevators

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: HansCM
Reviews.Content: There are some bad reviews floating around, mostly from Americans, about this hotel. What is true about the bad reviews: - very step stairway - very small toilets BUT, the rooms are CLEAN, the area is QUIET at night, the staff is HELPFUL if you are not too demanding and the LOCATION is very close to Leidesplein and the museum district. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An alright hotel...”
Reviews.Author: natural_mystic82
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with 3 friends in a 4 person room. the hotel itself was very clean and our room also had a balcony which was good for the smokers! The bathroom was also clean and shower and hot water worked really well. The room came equipped with a TV and cupboard for storage. Now, the bad points and probably the most important feature of all were the beds. Our room had 4 beds lined up in 1 line, but they were extremely uncomfortable. Â£ out of 4 of the beds were camper beds and no rigidity to them whatsoever and when you lay on them you sunk right in, very bad for the back.. Only 1 of our beds were a proper 4 legged one where we took rotations to sleep in. For this reason I will not be booking this hotel again to my next visit to Amsterdam. A few plus points were that the location is excellent, no more than a 15 minute walk to the centre and "happening" areas. Breakfast was also very adequate for a budget hotel, typically continental (pastries, boiled eggs, cheese and cold meats) that is you are up in enough time! We had no complaints about the staff and they were very helpful and polite. I would not stay here again until the beds are upgraded, which I think would dissuade most visitors. Please feel free to email more for further info: hiteshdhokia@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: Stevebiggs
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights with my partner here and really enjoyed my stay, the staff were really helpfull and informative as regards to where to go and what to do, breakfast was very good with cereal, toast, juice and coffee, the room was small but clean and looked out over the street which was quiet 99% of the time, I would urge people to ignore the negative reviews posted because this hotel is not that bad for the price, what do you want? The hilton?

Reviews.Title: “The best value I could find and within walking distance of all the attractions.”
Reviews.Author: egotrap
Reviews.Content: Reached by catching the No 1 tram from Centraal station to get to the Hotel. I bought a strippenkart but it looks as if everything is on a chipcard now in Amsterdam. I found the hotel the best value I could find on the internet. Anything cheaper was sharing with 6 or 8 people in a room. I would agree with other reviewers that the stairs are very very steep. I would not recommend it to anyone not able to climb a ladder. I'm 6 foot tall and just able to use the shared wc with a bit of contortion, and although it was clean the wc room was smaller than an in-flight wc, and that's small. However, on the last day I realised that there is a larger wc on the ground floor - use that one if you can, its okay. Being given only one towel for the three days seemed strange but I did not ask for another and I felt that they would have tried to please. The hotel was quiet although some of the guests were very rowdy on one of the nights. Alcohol is very popular at night in Amsterdam along with other things. It's always inconsiderate guests wherever you go. Breakfast was modest in selection but fresh and adequate. Contrary to other reviews I asked if I could leave my case on the last day and pick it up before returning to the aiport and it was no problem. All things considered it was great value for money booked in advance compared to other places and prices.

Reviews.Title: “Get out while you can!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kari36
Reviews.Content: okay- so the location is great... that is about the only good thing- BUT there are a million hotels in this area. There were a couple of ants in my room- not really big deal- I killed them and did not see any others, but the last night of my stay, there was a mouse in my room!!!!!! when i requested something be done, the receptionist refused to do so, and he told me all rooms were booked. The next day I found out there was one room open that had not been booked, but "most likely that receptionist lied to me because they have people come in in the late night for rooms and I would have taken up a valuable quad room." Then he blamed ME for the mouse because I had un-opened candybars in 2 zipblock bags-- I was on the 2nd floor, and i don't think a mouse smells candybars 2 floors up in a hotel and runs up there; especially considering there is a breakfast room and kitchen with food that is not in air tight packaging. Well now, I'm telling the world that they are an AWFUL hotel. In addition I wrote the manager and left it with the receptionist- at the end of it, I requested a follow-up, BUT never heard from him (my e-mail was included)... still waiting 2 MONTHS LATER. Also, there are NO ground floor rooms- you have to go up very narrow, very tiny steps (did i mention NO elevators) to get to your room- the receptionists at check-in and check-out were nice enough to carry my HEAVY suitcase for me up 2 flights of stairs. The lavatory has NO room to get in- if you are a larger person, there is no way you will be able to use it- i could barely stand in there (and i am an "average" sized person). The bad reviews I have browsed about this are definately telling the truth-- i don't trust the good ones after my stay. There are other hotels near this location that are much better-- find another hotel. Additionally, there was a group of girls complaining to the hotel staff as I was leaving. This place is a hell hole. only other pluses: "free" internet; breakfast included; 40% of the receptionists i encountered were good the other 60% were awful and have no business working with people.

Reviews.Title: “Barest minimum, not that nice”
Reviews.Author: esophian
Reviews.Content: The room is fine, the bed is fine. Shared toilet is disgusting -- stinks of urine and with barely enough room to even use the toilet. The shared shower wasn't nice either; it also smelled bad and seemed dirty. Don't even think of it during a warm period. There is no AC and no fan, either, and if you have the window open for some air, it's bright from street lights and loud from the restaurant across the street. The only other positives are that it's relatively cheap (80 Euros) and fairly convenient to the van Gogh museum.

Reviews.Title: “Guests are an inconvenience”
Reviews.Author: journalistLondon
Reviews.Content: All relatively OK until I asked at breakfast time to stay another night. Told the room was available but would have to pay there and then "or when you come down". Surprised by this but told them we would pay that morning. We were exhausted after a three week journey around Europe and my wife was not well, so we went upstairs to rest. After half an hour or so the receptionist came banging on our door asking us to pay. I told him it was usual to pay on leaving and anyway, was he really expecting me to leave without paying from a room on the second floor with loads of luggage and a three year old child under my arm? I have never heard such nonense. He just kept ranting on about his hotel policy and I am afraid I was just so tired and lacking patience to deal with him I just gently closed the door telling him I would come down and pay shortly. He was happy enough to take my credit card payment some ten minutes later (although he already had my credit card details anyway). Then on leaving the next morning, I had made it down the very steep stairs from the second floor with two backpacks, a suitcase, a pram and the child when he said I should go back upstairs to get the TV remote control. We were rushing for an international train and this was just the last straw. I told him he could get the remote himself and he said that we were now in Amsterdam and would have to do things as they do in Amsterdam, although the last time I looked Amsterdam was a rich, tolerant and modern European city where most people have got better things to do than steal TV remote controls after paying over 100 euros a night for a hotel. But he threatened to charge us another night unless we went back up and got it, even though I pointed out that the chambermaid was at that moment on the second floor and could get it for us. He then told me she was paid for cleaning not getting TV remote controls. I explained to him that we spent our money in his hotel and he was meant to provide the service. He then informed us that we only paid to sleep in the hotel, nothing more. So there you have it. The steep stairs are a feature of Amsterdam canal-side houses, which is characterful. However, be aware that the stairs are really steep and will pose problems for elderly or the young or anyone with mobility problems. The balcony in the room we had was equally pretty but dangerous for a child as it was only around half a metre high. The shower is in a corner of the toilet, with a shared floor, if you see what I mean. It threatens to overflow into the room as well as flooding the whole bathroom if you leave it on too long. No dead mice but a faint whiff in the rooms. Breakfast is OK for a hotel of this standard but surely in Amsterdam they should make real coffee instead of having a vending machine at breakfast. Breakfast room very cramped. Odd atmosphere among guests some of whom seem rather cowed by the experience. They also put little plastic bowls on the table for incidental rubbish such as the lids from jam portions, etc. Very strange and not what I come to a hotel for. Good internet access for 2 euros an hour. Beds comfortable if rooms and corridors a bit faded. One receptionist who was on duty at night, unlike the one mentioned above, was very helpful and pleasant. Seemed not to be a "company man". Unfortunately however, the other receptionsist is there most of the time, if our visit was anything to go by. Unless you come on holiday to be pushed around by arrogant hotel staff with silly and insulting "policies" I suggest you make it your policy to spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “At home at the Crystal”
Reviews.Author: MrJohnMd
Reviews.Content: This must be at least my 8th stay at the Crystal over a 4-5 year period. My first time there I thought it was a fine but extremely basic hotel with a very good staff. Over the years they have gotten better. New ownership on a mission. And each and every trip since the new owners took over I have seen steady improvements. New upscale coffee machine for expresso, etc. New safes in the room. New paint. A very cheap (3 euro for 2 hours) but modern new computer in the breakfast room. All the while they have kept their great staff and their great location. This may be as quiet a hotel as I have ever stayed in. At least right at the top for a budget hotel. Its still a fairly basic hotel. So if you want a lift and new and modern rooms you might want to look elsewhere. If you are after quiet, location, quality, a traditional dutch breakfast, value, and a moderate price------the Crystal should at least get some consideration. The absolute best thing about the hotel? Jasna and the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm.... not the best.”
Reviews.Author: KimiRai
Reviews.Content: It certainly isnt as bad as some of the reviews here suggest. Its like a B&B. If you want somewhere cheap and dry then this is fine. Like the reviews said, breakfast isnt great but its free... We had no dead mice, no left-over fags on the floor and the staff werent bad. Dont stay here if with girlfriend/wife. A trip with the boys is what its meant for... Nice quiet location and quite central.

Reviews.Title: “worst hoilday ever”
Reviews.Author: ladylaws001
Reviews.Content: i thought this was the worst place i have ever stayed i went for my mates birthday we got there and asked if we could leave our luggage until we got back as we arrived early and they left it in a dining room where anyone could get it and had to walk up 3 flights of very steep stairs very annoying as there isnt a lift and with suitcases wasnt very easy got up there and the room was not too bad went to see the toilet and shower in room and there was a very bad smell in there and no window shower wasnt even seperate from toilet just a curtain so every time u go to the toilet u got wet feet and there was a silly little chair in there aswell tried to get rid of the smell in there but couldnt theres no tea and coffee in the room so i went down stairs after 3 flights to get a coffee and the man told me he had just cleaned it out and i couldnt use it found the same problem with all staff each night apart from in the end one night they let me get some hotwater for tea and then they didnt even offer milk had to ask a couple of times as the man was with his girlfriend and i got ignored and found it very hard to take 2 teas back up stair no cold drinks on sale or food and where the coffee and tea machine is was very basic and no help to work it also i found the staff wasnt very welcoming or helpful wasnt aloud to keep your key with u u had to ring the bell to be let in and get the keys very dissapointed i wouldnt even recomment it to animals

Reviews.Title: “Best to find somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were asked to pay our bill, in cash. (Euros 715) there and then, without even seeing the room. We refused. We paid 100 euros. The room itself was quite pleasant, clean and quiet. Breakfast was awful. Some dubious people wakling about the place. On reception we hardly ever saw the same person twice, and never anyone of a managerial type. Three times during the week we were asked to pay our bill and told it must be in cash. We paid the bill on departure by credit card! Sorry to say not only in Hotel Crystal, but throughout Amsterdam, we felt people were trying to rip us off. Not the happiest of holidays. We won't recommend the hotel to anyone. One consolation: A central position for all the ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you stay at the Crystal Hotel don't expect much in terms of amenities. It is affordable for Amsterdam but I wouldn't recommend it if you're looking for older travelers, families or for honeymooners. It's great if you are single, a student or like bare-bones travel. The staircases are very steep and the stairs are very small. We didn't have a problem with them but I can imagine some people would have issues. Our room, a private with a bath, was very large and the linens were clean but that's about it. The bathroom was relatively clean but the carpet was not and the blankets and bedspreads were covered with cigarette burns and, on the blankets, stray hairs. The walls are paper thin. We could smell smoke from other rooms/floors in our room when the windows and doors were closed. Also, our room was right outside the shared toilet and, especially on a Saturday night, the opening and closing of the bathroom door woke us up every few hours. Overall it wasn't the worst place I've ever stayed in but it wasn't the best either. I wouldn't stay there again but it's because we had friends staying at a hotel around the corner and we saw their room and it was much nicer and they paid about the same price as we did (although their hotel did not include breakfast). The employees were very helpful and the breakfast was nice. Finally, no matter what their site says, they do not accept credit cards (although required for a reservation) and you have to pay cash, in-full, when you check-in. So if you're unsure about the room then I would suggest asking to see it before you pay.

Reviews.Title: “more plastic than crystal”
Reviews.Author: BetsyTripStar
Reviews.Content: Not expecting much from the hotel, the room was even worse than I imagined. The shared facilities were clean/fine and the sink/mirror in the room beneficial, the problem was the size of the room. It was very tiny. Don't believe the pictures. The bedspread had cigarette holes and was filthy. At night I made sure to sleep in full clothing, unsure of the cleanliness of the sheets. The window was also broken. There were some good things about the hotel like the location, high room ceilings, friendly staff and bowl of candy at reception. The hotel is also cheap, a major plus.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great for the price. Within walking distance of most major areas. Very close to Leidesplien, which is very cool. Room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was my worst hotel experience ever. Quoted wrong price initially at check-in. Led to filthy double room up 3 flights of tiny stairs. Window would not stay open in middle of summer. Ended up with bug bites from pillows. Manager is possibly rudest man alive and charged us for full stay though we left after 2 days owing to state of room. Also, he never believed us when we complained that there was a problem (like when the safe wasn't working). He would berate us and then try to prove us wrong--proving himself wrong in the process. He never once apologized, only muttered to himself and tried to fix it.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Crystal
HotelInfo.Address: 2e Helmersstraat 6, Amsterdam 1054 CH, The Netherlands
